channel.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
channel.description: I am trying to change the wilderness boundary in RSCD_v25 from where it begins in the bottom left corner of the wilderness at 335 426. Does anyone know where I can change these boundary coordinates?

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

I have actually already done that.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @zraffz zraffz
item.description:
@zraffz wrote:

[quote=“froggie, post:14, topic:263825”]public int wildernessLevel() { int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this)))); if(x + 2304 >= 2640) { wild = -50;

Based on the above code, what could be replaced in order to correctly move the wilderness boundary to the south? I have attempted to change different variables but when tested with a client, it appears as if I did not modify them.[/quote]
You have to change the coords that make the “Attack” option on the menu appear instead of the “Duel” option which is done in the mudclient I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

public int wildernessLevel() { int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this)))); if(x + 2304 >= 2640) { wild = -50;

Based on the above code, what could be replaced in order to correctly move the wilderness boundary to the south? I have attempted to change different variables but when tested with a client, it appears as if I did not modify them.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

getHeight means 4 levels of the world. 0 = mainland, 1 = first story, 2 = second story, 3 = underground.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

[quote=“froggie, post:11, topic:263825”][quote author=adu link=topic=348397.msg2680814#msg2680814 date=1235346985]

If the coordinates were changed to a larger area, what would a correct version appear as?

Wilderness is different.

This is the way it is now

public int wildernessLevel() {
		int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this))));
		if(x + 2304 >= 2640) {
			wild = -50;
		}
		if(wild > 0) {
                	return 1 + wild / 6;
                }
                return 0;
	}

As you can see, copying the modroom coords and changing them will not work.
[/quote]

I remember discovering that, however, while trying to run through the math to change the variables in regards to

int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this)

I could not figure out what getHeight(this) means. Is this the current height that the player is standing such as ground level? When I tried to change the 2203/1776 variables, it didn’t reflect a change in the X coordinate that the wilderness begins. Do I need to then change this in the client? Would the changes needed to be made be found inside Mudclient.java?[/quote]

public static int getHeight(Point location) { return getHeight(location.getY()); }

public static int getHeight(int y) { return (int)(y / 944); }

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:9, topic:263825”][quote author=froggie link=topic=348397.msg2680807#msg2680807 date=1235346560]
If the coordinates were changed to a larger area, what would a correct version appear as?
[/quote]

Wilderness is different.

This is the way it is now

public int wildernessLevel() {
		int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this))));
		if(x + 2304 >= 2640) {
			wild = -50;
		}
		if(wild > 0) {
                	return 1 + wild / 6;
                }
                return 0;
	}

As you can see, copying the modroom coords and changing them will not work.[/quote]

I remember discovering that, however, while trying to run through the math to change the variables in regards to

int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this)

I could not figure out what getHeight(this) means. Is this the current height that the player is standing such as ground level? When I tried to change the 2203/1776 variables, it didn’t reflect a change in the X coordinate that the wilderness begins. Do I need to then change this in the client? Would the changes needed to be made be found inside Mudclient.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Wilderness is different.

This is the way it is now

public int wildernessLevel() {
		int wild = 2203 - (y + (1776 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this))));
		if(x + 2304 >= 2640) {
			wild = -50;
		}
		if(wild > 0) {
                	return 1 + wild / 6;
                }
                return 0;
	}

As you can see, copying the modroom coords and changing them will not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“froggie, post:6, topic:263825”] public boolean inWilderness() { return wildernessLevel() > 0; }

public boolean inWilderness() { return inBounds(64, 1639, 80, 1643); //taken from the modroom boundaries }[/quote]

Im sorry but that is completly wrong, you cannot copy an paste the modroom bounds.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the wilderness boundary
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

How “dear god” explained it makes perfect sence. In point.java there is coords of ‘inWilderness’, changing the coords of that and the coords of ‘inWildrness’ in your client will change the extent of the wildy.
